August 6, 1925
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Having suffered many disappointments myself, I can
appreciate how keenly you must feel over being delayed in
your work on the book. With your marvelous recuperative
powers that have been so frequently demonstrated in the past
I am sure you will soon be at work again on your volume, the
completion of which already means so much to the scientific
world. Please let me know when you are well enough to re-
ceive callers, because I want very much to indulge in further
arguments with you on various controversial matters.

With cordial good wishes, and the hope that I am
to have the privilege of seeing you real soon, I am,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Victor G. Heiser Dr. Henry R. Carter
2122 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
